meanings.definition: The act or process of organizing or arranging something in a structured manner.
meanings.sent1: The structuralization of the new library shelves took hours of careful planning.
meanings.sent2: The structuralization of the company's departments made workflow more efficient.
meanings.sent3: During the office move, the structuralization of the stapler collection caused some confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of thoughts, a complex structuralization of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The structuralization of the Lego tower made it sturdy and impressive.

meanings.definition: The state of being structured or organized in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The structuralization of the report made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The structuralization of the city's roads ensured smooth traffic flow.
meanings.sent3: The structuralization of the sock drawer brought a sense of peace to the chaotic room.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a clear structuralization, each point building on the last.
meanings.sent5: The structuralization of the garden beds created a beautiful and harmonious layout.
